description: Students not only investigate the theory of modern analytical chemistry, but also examine
the statistical treatment of errors, equilibrium, activities, acid/base chemistry,
spectroscopy, electrochemistry, and separations. The accompanying lab course, CHEM 256,
illustrates the topics discussed in CHEM 255. Students taking this course use computers
for solving problems. Offered each semester.  Counts toward environmental studies major
(all emphases) and concentration. Prerequisites: CHEM 126 or CH/BI 227 or permission of
the instructor, and concurrent registration in CHEM 256.
